name: 2-phenylhydroquinone
Reason: 2-phenylhydroquinone has a melting point that we can analyze by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The phenyl group (c1ccc(cc1)C) adds rigidity and molecular weight, increasing the melting point by approximately +30°C. The hydroquinone moiety (Oc2cc(ccc2O)) introduces two phenolic hydroxyl groups, which participate in hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by approximately +20°C. The ketone group (O) introduces a carbonyl functional group, which can participate in dipole interactions, raising the melting point by approximately +10°C.
